org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.slip.utils

Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.slip.utils.Packet

  • @NonNullByDefault
public class Packet
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for handling of packets i.e. array of bytes.

    Methods available:

    • Packet(byte[]) creates a Packet object based on the array of bytes.
    • length() returns the number of bytes contained within this Packet.
    • toByteArray() returns the complete Packet as array of bytes.
    • getByteArray(int, int) returns the a range of bytes as array of bytes.
    • toString(java.lang.String) returns the complete packet as human-readable String.
    • getOneByteValue(int) returns the value of one byte as int.
    • setOneByteValue(int, int) sets the value of one byte within the Packet.
    • getTwoByteValue(int) returns the value of two bytes as int.
    • setTwoByteValue(int, int) sets the value of two bytes within the Packet.
    • getFourByteValue(int) returns the value of four bytes as int.
    • setFourByteValue(int, int) sets the value of four bytes within the Packet.
    • getString(int, int) returns the value of a range of bytes as String.
    • setString(int, java.lang.String) sets the value of a range of bytes within the Packet.
    Static methods are:
    • shortToString(int) converts a byte into a human-readable hex-String.
    • byteArrayToInt(byte[]) converts a range of four bytes into an int.
    • intToIPAddressString(int) converts an int into a String.
    Author:
    Guenther Schreiner - Initial contribution.

      • getTwoByteValue

        public int getTwoByteValue(int position)
        Returns the value of the bytes at the positions (n)th and (n+1) as int value for convenience.

        Note: Big-endian LSB-0 encoding.

        Parameters:
        position - Position (n) within the packet.
        Returns:
        value of type int.

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(int position,
                                  int length)
        Returns the char string converted byte-by-byte starting at the position (n) up to (n+length+1).

        Note: Any trailing null char will be eliminated.

        Parameters:
        position - Position (n) within the packet.
        length - Length of the intended slice as int.
        Returns:
        value of type String.

      • setString

        public void setString(int position,
                      java.lang.String text)
        Modifies the value of the bytes starting at the position (n) by setting it to the character values passed as String.

        Note: The trailing null char will not be stored.

        Parameters:
        position - Position (n) within the packet.
        text - of type String.
